columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer.
columns.payment_method_code: The code indicating the customer's payment method.
columns.customer_code: The unique alphanumeric code for the customer.
columns.customer_name: The full name of the customer.
columns.customer_address: The address where the customer resides.
columns.customer_phone: The phone number for contacting the customer.
columns.customer_email: The email address of the customer.

Customers.table_description: The table stores customer information for the department store.

columns.staff_id: The unique identifier for each staff member.
columns.staff_gender: The gender of the staff member, represented by a single character.
columns.staff_name: The full name of the staff member.

Staff.table_description: The table stores information about staff members in the department store.

columns.supplier_id: The unique identifier for each supplier.
columns.supplier_phone: The contact phone number for the supplier.

Suppliers.table_description: The table stores information about suppliers for the department store.

columns.department_id: The unique identifier for each department.
columns.dept_store_id: The identifier linking the department to its store.
columns.department_name: The name of the department, such as marketing or human resource.

Departments.table_description: The table stores department information for the department store.

columns.order_item_id: The unique identifier for each order item.
columns.order_id: The identifier linking the order item to its order.
columns.product_id: The identifier linking the order item to its product.

Order_Items.table_description: The table stores information about items in customer orders.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product supplied.
columns.supplier_id: The unique identifier for each supplier.
columns.date_supplied_from: The date when the product supply started.
columns.date_supplied_to: The date when the product supply ended.
columns.total_amount_purchased: The total amount purchased of the product.
columns.total_value_purchased: The total monetary value of purchased products.

Product_Suppliers.table_description: The table tracks supply details between products and suppliers.

columns.product_id: The unique identifier for each product.
columns.product_type_code: The code indicating the type of product, like clothes or hardware.
columns.product_name: The name of the product, providing specific details.
columns.product_price: The price of the product, displayed in monetary format.

Products.table_description: The table stores detailed information about products available for sale.

columns.address_id: The unique identifier for each address.
columns.address_details: The detailed description of the address, including street and location.

Addresses.table_description: The table stores address information for suppliers and customers.

columns.dept_store_chain_id: The unique identifier for each store chain.
columns.dept_store_chain_name: The name of the department store chain, such as North or South.

Department_Store_Chain.table_description: The table holds information about different department store chains.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer placing an order.
columns.order_id: The unique identifier for each customer order.
columns.order_status_code: The current status of the order, indicating its progress.
columns.order_date: The date and time when the order was placed.

Customer_Orders.table_description: The table tracks orders made by customers in the department store.

columns.dept_store_id: The unique identifier for each department store.
columns.dept_store_chain_id: The identifier linking the store to its chain.
columns.store_name: The name of the department store.
columns.store_address: The address where the department store is located.
columns.store_phone: The phone number for contacting the department store.
columns.store_email: The email address for reaching the department store.

Department_Stores.table_description: The table stores information about various department stores in the chain.

columns.customer_id: The unique identifier for each customer associated with an address.
columns.address_id: The unique identifier for each address linked to a customer.
columns.date_from: The date when the customer started using the address.
columns.date_to: The date when the customer stopped using the address.

Customer_Addresses.table_description: The table maintains address history for customers in the department store.

columns.staff_id: The unique identifier for each staff member assigned to a department.
columns.department_id: The unique identifier for each department assigned to the staff member.
columns.date_assigned_from: The date when the staff was assigned to the department.
columns.job_title_code: The code representing the staff member's job title in the department.
columns.date_assigned_to: The date when the staff member's assignment ended.

Staff_Department_Assignments.table_description: The table tracks assignments of staff members to specific departments.

columns.supplier_id: The unique identifier for each supplier associated with an address.
columns.address_id: The unique identifier for each address linked to a supplier.
columns.date_from: The date when the supplier began using the address.
columns.date_to: The date when the supplier stopped using the address.

Supplier_Addresses.table_description: The table maintains historical addresses for each supplier.
